description.narrative: The Project seeks to help increase stability, specifically in the areas affected by the Syrian crisis, through improving livelihood and service provision in a conflict sensitive manner.

description.narrative: •No of services delivered •No of participatory plans •No. of scholarships for school •No. of patients assisted •All municipalities have coordination mechanisms •Number of community committees formed. •Number of participants in the community committees. •Number of assessments completed in a participatory manner. •Number of individuals trained on dispute resolution. •Percentage of trained individuals actively solving disputes in their communities. •Number of assessments and updates undertaken. •Number of assessments provided to the government. •Number of coordination meetings held.

comment.narrative: •High unemployment amongst youth and women; •Limited job opportunities and weak private sector investment; •Loss and/or depletion of livelihood assets, and economic opportunities •Weak economic and productive infrastructures; •Limited financial services targeting poor and vulnerable people. •Limited knowledge on the available services by the local communities is contributing to the increasing tension. •Lack of services •Vulnerable population unable to access services •Lack of participatory mechanisms for service delivery •Local communities are vulnerable to external shocks due to limited skills and institutionalized mechanisms for preventing tension from exploding into conflict. •Lack of institutionalized local level mechanisms for dealing with disputes. •Lack of systematic conflict prevention and conflict resolution instruments being utilized by local leaders. •Limited skill base of key local leaders in dealing with disputes and conflicts affecting their villages.
▪ At least 20 Inter-Sectorial Municipal Action Plans Updated ▪ At least 30 host communities targeted ▪ At least 40 projects implemented across different sectors

In 2018, LHSP contributed to strengthening the capacity of national and local actors in the delivery of basic services through the implementation of 38 basic and social services projects in 34 communities in the sectors of energy, municipal infrastructure, water management, wastewater management, recreational spaces, solid waste management, and flood risk management in highly vulnerable municipalities across the country. Moreover, one Primary Health Care Centre (PHCC), and 4 Public Schools were supported. Knowing that the number of Lebanese beneficiaries of basic and social services projects reached 196,355 beneficiaries, and that of Syrian beneficiaries of the same projects attained 75,712 beneficiaries. Also 29 multi-sectoral local plans (community level MSRs) were developed. 932 participants (648 Males 284 Females) were involved in the communities’ plans. Regarding the livelihood’s projects, in 2018, LHSP implemented 12 projects, benefitting 20,988 Lebanese and 33,524 displaced Syrians. It focused on the revitalization of the Lebanese economy and economic opportunities by strengthening livelihoods and creating jobs for host communities. With the implemented projects, 12 income generation initiatives were supported across a range of interventions related to SMEs/cooperatives support (7), and economic Infrastructure (5). 6 value chain assessments were developed: 3 in agriculture (Freekeh, Oregano and Honey) and 3 in renewable energy. Within the Honey Value Chain intervention, a total of 162 Youth benefitted from sector specific training, of which 150 were integrated in the labour market. It is worth noting that three partners in business and employment support (Chambers of Commerce, Business Incubators) were engaged in the youth employability project. In addition to the above, one joint initiative was implemented with the private sector targeting 20 women cooperatives to improve their market outreach.
▪ At least 20 Inter-Sectorial Municipal Action Plans Updated ▪ At least 30 host communities targeted ▪ At least 40 projects implemented across different sectors

In 2019, LHSP contributed to strengthening the capacity of national and local actors in the delivery of basic services through the implementation of 48 basic and social services projects in 41 communities in the sectors of energy, municipal infrastructure, water management, wastewater management, recreational spaces, solid waste management, and flood risk management in highly vulnerable municipalities across the country. The number of Lebanese beneficiaries of basic and social services projects reached 377,355 beneficiaries, and that of Syrian beneficiaries of the same projects attained 183,318 beneficiaries. Also 282 multi-sectoral local plans (community level MSRs) were developed. 3523 participants (956 Males 2567 Females) were involved in the communities’ plans. Regarding the livelihood’s projects, in 2019, LHSP implemented 17 projects, benefiting 264,275 Lebanese and 126,545 displaced Syrians. It focused on the revitalization of the Lebanese economy and economic opportunities by strengthening livelihoods and creating jobs for host communities.
▪ At least 20 host communities targeted ▪ At least 40 projects implemented across different sectors

The main achievement was to successfully implement 64 projects under the sectors of livelihoods and social stability benefitting 25 communities and 1 cluster. A total of 163,028 Lebanese beneficiaries and 113,154 Syrian beneficiaries were reached through the interventions.
In addition, the project was able to respond to the health and socio-economic impact of COVID-19 through: rehabilitating and equipping 8 Government-led isolation centers with the aim of containing the spread of the virus, especially in vulnerable areas; and supporting 193 SMEs and 88 Cooperatives.
Finally, as a response to the Beirut Blast, UNDP was involved in activities in support to families and businesses highly impacted by the explosion. The main activities consisted of shelter rehabilitation for 105 housing units, food parcel distribution for 105 families, PSS support and support to 22 SMEs/shops in the areas most affected by the blast.
